Mention issue with data attributes and jQuery

Using jQuery with data attributes is a common enough use case that it would be helpful to explicitly state the issue in the README. Since the behavior caused by the bug is puzzling to debug (one word attributes work, any attribute more than one word doesn't work), this change should save developers some time.

#285 Improve Bootstrap 4 support In bootstrap 4 we no longer use an additional div around the dropdown-items. For this I needed 2 changes. 1. Add the 'addBack' functionality so I can select the item element it self 2. I added a itemContentSelector. With this you can change the selector for getting the element in which you want to add the content. For backwards compatibility reasons I have set this to 'a' as default. To get a Bootstrap 4 example I had to set the following: { menu: "
", item: "", headerHtml: "
", headerDivider: "
", itemContentSelector: '.dropdown-item' }

[fix] bloodhound since v0.11 needs two callback methods
Readme cleanup

Only swallow tab on keyup if no key

In order to get around the problem of tab/shift-tab not defocusing the
field, remember if a key has been pressed since the field received
focus.  If not, it's ok to swallow the tab on keyup.  Otherwise, pass it
through

Handle tabbing into a field with showHintOnFocus

As noted in
https://github.com/bassjobsen/Bootstrap-3-Typeahead/issues/107, when
`showHintOnFocus` is not `false` and a user tabs into an auto-select field,
the `keyUp` from the tab press causes the first item in the list to be
selected.

This is rarely what is wanted, so this commit changes the `keyup`
handler to ignore tabs when the list is shown and `showHintOnFocus` is
set.

Note that this does mean that pressing the tab key when
`showHintOnFocus` is set will never select the highlighted item if any, whereas
when `showHintOnFocus` is false it will.

Merge pull request #251 from djoike/empty-string

Prevent crash when "item.name" is an empty string.
Prevent crash when "item" is an object with property "name", but "name" is an empty string. The previous shorthand would return "item" when "item.name" was an empty string, resulting in an exception.

#185 #232 Now if user clicks on the scrollbar in the menu in IE, the dropdown stays open but it will close if you click elsewhere
This is also a better fix for #176 that works in all cases, in IE the focus handler was called after the hidingMenu flag was reset. So reset it in the focus method. It was renamed skipShowHintOnFocus for clarity.
Finally, it includes a fix to #213 for IE that triggers the input event on focus if the input has a placeholder.

Merge pull request #219 from dcohenb/license_format_fix

Format the license in package.json to match the SPDX standard

Format the license in package.json to match the SPDX standard

As documented on the NPM documentation (https://docs.npmjs.com/files/package.json#license). The license field has to comply with the SPDX specification for communicating the licenses and copyrights associated with a software package. This commit changes the license to a valid SPDX value (MIT)

Merge pull request #6 from MissChocoe/master

Added support for minLength=0, added all value for items and showHintOnFocus option

Added support for a minLength of 0, added all options for items count and added showHintOnFocus option

Added support for a minLength of 0 that displays the hints on focus and when user clears the field. The showHintsOnFocus can be set to true so hints are shown whenever user enters the field (even if minLength is grater than 0). You can also set the count of items to 'all' if you do not want to limit the number of items shown. This is always the case when minLength == 0 and no value is enter (all the hints are shown).
